descript.abstract: Polygon developed for cartographic convenience to conceal features beyond the District of Columbia boundary. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters. METADATA CONTENT IS IN PROCESS OF VALIDATION AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE.
descript.purpose: This data is used for the planning and management of Washington, D.C. by local government agencies.

idinfo.useconst: For data terms and conditions, go toÂ http://dc.gov/page/terms-and-conditions-use-district-data

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.780

attracc.attraccr: Not validated by source and/or responsible agency.

dataqual.logic: Not validated by source and/or responsible agency.
dataqual.complete: Data believed to be complete and accurate, subject to change. Digital version compared with original source data for accuracy and completeness. In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

horizpa.horizpar: In process of validation by source and/or responsible agency.

procstep.procdesc: Polygon developed for cartographic convenience to conceal features overlapping beyond the District of Columbia boundary. Created polygon and used ArcInfo to cut a hole in the middle based on the District of Columbia boundary. All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.

cntorgp.cntorg: D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer
D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer

distinfo.distliab: Acknowledgment of the DC Geographic Information Systems Program (DC GIS). The District of Columbia Government makes no claims as to the completeness, accuracy or content of any data contained hereon, and makes no representation of any kind, including, but not limited to, the warranty of the accuracy or fitness for a particular use, nor are any such warranties to be implied or inferred with respect to the information or data furnished herein.
distinfo.custom: Most DC GIS datasets can be downloaded from "http://dcgis.dc.gov" on the data center page. Orders can also be made by contacting OCTO GIS at "dcgis@dc.gov", especially for datasets not available for download.
